bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: Please compile Emacs with module support
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): emacs 25
How reproducible:
Steps to Reproduce: 1. 2. 3.
Actual results:
Expected results:
Additional info: Please add the configure flag "--with-modules" for emacs-25 for Fedora 24, 25 and Rawhide. Also, please don't strip the resultant emacs binaries. Thanks.

(In reply to nyc4bos from comment #0) > Please add the configure flag "--with-modules" for emacs-25 for Fedora 24, > 25 and Rawhide.
Why?
> Also, please don't strip the resultant emacs binaries.
Fedora packages are built with -O2 and then stripped, I can't do anything about that. You can install emacs-debuginfo if you want the debug symbols.

>> Please add the configure flag "--with-modules" for emacs-25 for Fedora 24, >> 25 and Rawhide.
>Why?
So that one can utilize Emacs module (FFI) support.
> Also, please don't strip the resultant emacs binaries.
>> Fedora packages are built with -O2 and then stripped, I can't do anything >> >> about that. You can install emacs-debuginfo if you want the debug symbols.
Unfortunately, stripping interferes with GDB support.
Now that Gnu Emacs 25.2 has just been officially released, please provide Emacs with the configure flag "--with-modules" for emacs-25.2 for Fedora 24, Fedora 25, and "Fedora 26".
emacs-25.2-2.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-1976641eba
